newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Senate amends Telstra sale bill.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Senate amends Telstra sale bill.

text.p: The Australian Senate on Tuesday passed an amendment to the Telstra privatisation bill, as proposed by key independent Brian Harradine, but adjourned before completing a final vote on the bill.
The government now sees the final vote, expected to approve the bill, on Wednesday.

The amendment, embodying a deal between Harradine and the government announced on Thursday, would delay the planned sale of a third of Telstra's shares while a committee examined Harradine's proposal for the alternative issue of redeemable preference shares.
The government expects the privatisation to raise about A$8 billion.
It needs the support of Harradine and another independent, Mal Colston, but announced measures last week to satisfy the concerns of both.
The amendment passed with the support of the government and both independents, the same teaming that earlier voted down amendments by the minority Democrats party.
